api_url.Description: the url for the gridscale API.

max_n_retries.Description: Custom maximum number of retries. The retryable requests can be retried up to max_n_retries. If max_n_retries is reached and the request is not successful, the last error is returned.

request_delay_interval.Description: Custom request delay interval in ms. This time interval is used to delay the synchronous request checks, or delay retryable requests.

active.Description: The status of the schedule active or not

change_time.Description: Defines the date and time of the last object change

create_time.Description: Defines the date and time the object was initially created

keep_backups.Description: The amount of storage backups to keep before overwriting the last created backup

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object

next_runtime.Description: The date and time that the storage backup schedule will be run. Format: "2006-01-02 15:04:05"

next_runtime_computed.Description: The date and time that the storage backup schedule will be run. This date and time is computed by gridscale's server.

run_interval.Description: The interval at which the schedule will run (in minutes)

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object

storage_uuid.Description: UUID of the storage used to create storage backups

allowed_ip_ranges.Description: Allowed CIDR block or IP address in CIDR notation.

anon_gid.Description: Target group id when root squash is active.

anon_uid.Description: Target user id when root squash is active.

change_time.Description: Time of the last change.

create_time.Description: Date time this service has been created.

listen_port.Description: The port numbers where this Filesystem service accepts connections.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

release.Description:
The Filesystem service release of this instance.\n
				For convenience, please use gscloud https://github.com/gridscale/gscloud to get the list of available Filesystem service releases.

root_squash.Description: Map root user/group ownership to anon_uid/anon_gid

security_zone_uuid.Description: Security zone UUID linked to Filesystem service.

service_template_uuid.Description: PaaS service template that Filesystem service uses.

status.Description: Current status of Filesystem service.

usage_in_minutes.Description: Number of minutes that Filesystem service is in use.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters

private.Description: The object is private, the value will be true. Otherwise the value will be false.

action.Description: This defines what the firewall will do. Either accept or drop.

dst_cidr.Description: Either an IPv4/6 address or and IP Network in CIDR format. If this field is empty then all IPs have access to this service.

dst_port.Description: A Number between 1 and 65535, port ranges are seperated by a colon for FTP

order.Description:
The order at which the firewall will compare packets against its rules.
A packet will be compared against the first rule, it will either allow it to pass or block it
and it won't be matched against any other rules. However, if it does no match the rule,
then it will proceed onto rule 2. Packets that do not match any rules are blocked by default (Only for inbound).

src_cidr.Description: Either an IPv4/6 address or and IP Network in CIDR format. If this field is empty then this service has access to all IPs.

src_port.Description: A Number between 1 and 65535, port ranges are seperated by a colon for FTP

letsencrypt_ssl.Description: A valid domain name that points to the loadbalancer's IP address.

listen_port.Description: Specifies the entry port of the load balancer.

mode.Description: Supports HTTP and TCP mode. Valid values: http, tcp.

mariadb_max_allowed_packet.Description: Max Allowed Packet Size. Format: xM (where x is an integer, M stands for unit: k(kB), M(MB), G(GB)).

mariadb_query_cache_limit.Description: Query Cache Limit. Format: xM (where x is an integer, M stands for unit: k(kB), M(MB), G(GB)).

max_core_count.Description: Maximum CPU core count. The MariaDB instance's CPU core count will be autoscaled based on the workload. The number of cores stays between 1 and `max_core_count`.

legacy.Description: Legacy-Hardware emulation instead of virtio hardware. If enabled, hotplugging cores, memory, storage, network, etc. will not work, but the server will most likely run every x86 compatible operating system. This mode comes with a performance penalty, as emulated hardware does not benefit from the virtio driver infrastructure.

the product_no of the license (see the /prices endpoint for more details)

location_country.Description: The human-readable name of the location

location_iata.Description: Uses IATA airport code, which works as a location identifier

location_name.Description: The human-readable name of the location

location_uuid.Description: The location this object is placed.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object

object_storage_export.Description: Export snapshot to a object storage

host.Description: Host of object storage. Must be of URL type. E.g: https://gos3.io

rollback.Description: Returns a storage to the state of the selected Snapshot.

id.Description: ID of the rollback request. Each rollback request has to have a unique id. ID can be any string value.

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object

storage_uuid.Description: UUID of the storage used to create this snapshot

usage_in_minutes.Description: Total minutes the object has been running

change_time.Description: Defines the date and time of the last object change

create_time.Description: Defines the date and time the object was initially created

keep_snapshots.Description: The amount of Snapshots to keep before overwriting the last created Snapshot

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object

next_runtime.Description: The date and time that the snapshot schedule will be run

next_runtime_computed.Description: The date and time that the snapshot schedule will be run. This date and time is computed by gridscale's server.

run_interval.Description: The interval at which the schedule will run (in minutes)

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object

storage_uuid.Description: UUID of the storage used to create snapshots

change_time.Description: Time of the last change.

create_time.Description: Date time this service has been created.

listen_port.Description: The port numbers where this MS SQL Server accepts connections.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

password.Description: Password for MS SQL Server. It is used to connect to the MS SQL Server instance.

performance_class.Description: Performance class of MS SQL Server.

release.Description:
The MS SQL Server release of this instance.\n
				For convenience, please use gscloud https://github.com/gridscale/gscloud to get the list of available MS SQL Server releases.

s3_backup.Description: Allow backup/restore MS SQL server to/from a S3 bucket.

backup_access_key.Description: Access key used to authenticate against Object Storage server.

backup_bucket.Description: Object Storage bucket to upload backups to and restore backups from.

backup_retention.Description: Retention (in seconds) for local originals of backups. (0 for immediate removal once uploaded to Object Storage (default), higher values for delayed removal after the given time and once uploaded to Object Storage).

backup_secret_key.Description: Secret key used to authenticate against Object Storage server.

backup_server_url.Description: Object Storage server URL the bucket is located on.

security_zone_uuid.Description: Security zone UUID linked to MS SQL Server.

service_template_uuid.Description: PaaS service template that MS SQL Server uses.

status.Description: Current status of MS SQL Server.

usage_in_minutes.Description: Number of minutes that MS SQL Server is in use.

username.Description: Username for MS SQL Server . It is used to connect to the MS SQL Server instance.

create_time.Description: The date and time the object was initially created

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

sshkey.Description: sshkey_string is the OpenSSH public key string (all key types are supported => ed25519, ecdsa, dsa, rsa, rsa1)

certificate_chain.Description: The PEM-formatted full-chain between the certificate authority and the domain's SSL certificate.

common_name.Description: The common domain name of the SSL certificate.

create_time.Description: The date and time the object was initially created.

fingerprints.Description: Defines a list of unique identifiers generated from the MD5, SHA-1, and SHA-256 fingerprints of the certificate.

leaf_certificate.Description: The PEM-formatted public SSL of the SSL certificate.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

not_valid_after.Description: Defines the date after which the certificate is not valid.

private_key.Description: The PEM-formatted private-key of the SSL certificate.

action.Description: This defines what the firewall will do. Either accept or drop.

dst_cidr.Description: Either an IPv4/6 address or and IP Network in CIDR format. If this field is empty then all IPs have access to this service.

dst_port.Description: A Number between 1 and 65535, port ranges are seperated by a colon for FTP

order.Description:
The order at which the firewall will compare packets against its rules.
A packet will be compared against the first rule, it will either allow it to pass or block it
and it won't be matched against any other rules. However, if it does no match the rule,
then it will proceed onto rule 2. Packets that do not match any rules are blocked by default (Only for inbound).

src_cidr.Description: Either an IPv4/6 address or and IP Network in CIDR format. If this field is empty then this service has access to all IPs.

src_port.Description: A Number between 1 and 65535, port ranges are seperated by a colon for FTP

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object

usage_in_minutes.Description: Total minutes the object has been running.

version.Description: Upstream version of the ISO image release

algorithm.Description: The algorithm used to process requests. Accepted values: roundrobin/leastconn.

forwarding_rule.Description: List of forwarding rules for the Load balancer.

certificate_uuid.Description: The UUID of a custom certificate.

letsencrypt_ssl.Description: A valid domain name that points to the loadbalancer's IP address.

listen_port.Description: Specifies the entry port of the load balancer.

mode.Description: Supports HTTP and TCP mode. Valid values: http, tcp.

target_port.Description: Specifies the exit port that the load balancer uses to forward the traffic to the backend server.

listen_ipv4_uuid.Description: The UUID of the IPv4 address the Load balancer will listen to for incoming requests.

listen_ipv6_uuid.Description: The UUID of the IPv6 address the Load balancer will listen to for incoming requests.

location_uuid.Description: The location this object is placed.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters

redirect_http_to_https.Description: Whether the Load balancer is forced to redirect requests from HTTP to HTTPS

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object.

category.Description: Category of marketplace application. Accepted values: "CMS", "project management", "Adminpanel", "Collaboration", "Cloud Storage", "Archiving"

change_time.Description: Defines the date and time of the last object change

create_time.Description: Defines the date and time the object was initially created

is_application_owner.Description: Whether the you are the owner of application or not

is_publish_global.Description: Whether a template is published to other partner or not

is_publish_global_requested.Description: Whether a partner wants their tenant template published to other partners

is_publish_requested.Description: Whether the tenants want their template to be published or not

is_published.Description: Whether the template is published by the partner to their tenant

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters

object_storage_path.Description: Path to the images for the application, must be in .gz format and started with s3//

publish_global_requested_date.Description: The date when a partner requested their tenants template to be published

publish_requested_date.Description: The date when the tenant requested their template to be published

published_date.Description: The date when the template is published into other tenant in the same partner

published_global_date.Description: The date when a template is published to other partner

setup_memory.Description: The capacity of server's memory in GB

setup_storage_capacity.Description: The capacity of server's storage in GB

status.Description: status indicates the status of the object

unique_hash.Description: Unique hash to allow user to import the self-created marketplace application

delete_block.Description: If deleting this network is allowed

legacy.Description: Legacy-Hardware emulation instead of virtio hardware. If enabled, hotplugging cores, memory, storage, network, etc. will not work, but the server will most likely run every x86 compatible operating system. This mode comes with a performance penalty, as emulated hardware does not benefit from the virtio driver infrastructure.

resource_id.Description: ID of a SSL certificate resource

capacity.Description: The capacity of a storage in GB.

change_time.Description: Defines the date and time of the last object change.

create_time.Description: Defines the date and time the object was initially created.

license_product_no.Description: If a template has been used that requires a license key (e.g. Windows Servers) this shows the product_no of the license (see the /prices endpoint for more details).

location_country.Description: Two digit country code (ISO 3166-2) of the location where this object is placed.

location_iata.Description: Uses IATA airport code, which works as a location identifier.

location_name.Description: The human-readable name of the location. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

location_uuid.Description: The location this object is placed.

name.Description: The human-readable name of the object. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters.

status.Description: status indicates the status of the object.

capacity.Description: The capacity of a storage/ISO image/template/snapshot in GB.

change_time.Description: The date and time of the last object change.

create_time.Description: The date and time the object was initially created.

current_price.Description: Defines the price for the current period since the last bill.

distro.Description: The OS distribution that the template contains.

license_product_no.Description: If a template has been used that requires a license key (e.g. Windows Servers) this shows the product_no of the license (see the /prices endpoint for more details).

location_country.Description: Two digit country code (ISO 3166-2) of the location where this object is placed.

location_iata.Description: Uses IATA airport code, which works as a location identifier

location_name.Description: The human-readable name of the location. It supports the full UTF-8 character set, with a maximum of 64 characters

location_uuid.Description: The location this object is placed.

name.Description: name of the domain

ostype.Description: The operating system installed in the template

private.Description: The object is private, the value will be true. Otherwise the value will be false.

status.Description: Status indicates the status of the object

usage_in_minutes.Description: Total minutes the object has been running.
